newsitem.title: USA: Teamsters' Carey begins new term.
newsitem.headline: Teamsters' Carey begins new term.

text.p: Ron Carey was sworn in Saturday for a new term as president of the Teamsters Union and promptly attacked what he called a corporate strategy of treating employees as "throwaway workers."
In his inaugural address he called on the 1.4 million members of the union to unite behind a push to fight what he called a culture of "corporate greed" that creates "throwaway workers."

"Corporations want a society where they use you up and then dump you, a society where there is no loyalty to working people and families and no reward for hard work," Carey said in his inaugural address.

The union said some 2,000 teamsters and their families from across the country filled the streets around the Teamsters' headquarters to take part in the swearing-in ceremonies for Carey and 26 other newly elected and re-elected international union officers.
Carey leads a fractious organisation after a bitterly contested election against James Hoffa.
He said the union will push to make companies and politicians more accountable to working families, the union said.
